Kullu road accident.description: MANALI: At least 44 people have died and 29 sustained injured on Thursday when a bus fell into a gorge in Himachal's Kullu district. Kullu superintendent of police (SP) Shalini Agnihotri said several women and kids were among the injured. The vehicle had started its journey from the Banjar bus stand around 4pm and covered barely 2km when it met with an accident. The driver apparently lost control while negotiating a sharp turn at the Bhiyoth Mor, which has a gradient of more than 75 degrees. Eyewitnesses said the bus veered off the road to scrape the mountain face before hurtling down the gorge. Local residents and police personnel faced difficulty locating and extricating the bodies from the mangled mass of metal. Parts of the vehicle were strewn over a wide swathe of the bottom of the gorge. Between 2009 and 2018, Himachal Pradesh recorded 30,993 road accidents in which 11,561 people were killed and 53,909 injured. This year alone, as many as 430 people died in 1,168 road accidents in the state till May 31. In Video:Several killed as bus falls into gorge in Himachal Pradesh's KulluDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

All Nagpur buses to run on CNG by fiscal.description: NAGPUR: In a move that will put a major check on air pollution in city, transport department of Nagpur Municipal Corporation is to convert all 431 city buses from diesel-run to CNG-run. It will also induct five electric buses in 2019-20. Jitendra Kukde, chairman of NMC’s transport committee, mentioned this in his budget of Rs277.84 crore for 2019-20 presented before the standing committee chairman Pradip Pohane. The expected expenditure of the department will be Rs 278.41 crore. Now, Pohane will include transport panel’s budget in his budget to be presented in the general body. Kukde has projected a revenue of Rs 90 crore from sale of tickets while remaining Rs 188.41 crore funding from standing committee. The panel chief said the department will earn Rs 25 lakh from bus shelters advertisements. Following the vision of Union transport minister Nitin Gadkari to promote ecofriendly public transport, Kukde has proposed to convert all 235 standard buses, 150 midi and 45 mini buses to run on CNG. Already the civic body had converted one bus to run on CNG, he said. Kukde also announced migration of all NMC’s owned four-wheelers, including mayor’s car, to CNG. “By end of this financial year, entire Aapli Bus fleet will run on CNG,” Kukde claimed. About strengthening Aapli Bus service in congested areas like Itwari, Mahal, Mominpura, Kukde said operation of mini-buses will start by next month. Already, 15 buses have arrived and remaining 30 will join the Aapli bus fleet soon. “Even MahaMetro has approached the civic body for starting feeder bus service from its stations. We will provide mini-buses for the purpose,” he said. He announced provision of free travel for specially-abled persons and women kin of martyrs. He said civic body will bear the expenditure for martyrs’ kin under ‘Mi Jijao Mata scheme,’ while state’s social welfare department will fund specially-abled persons’ travel. Kukde has proposed to provide common mobility card that could be used both on Metro as well as Aapli Buses. He also proposed to set up water ATMs near major bus shelters and earmarked Rs 2 crore for the purpose. Already the service has been introduced at a bus shelter near KDK College and is getting good response, he claimed. He also proposed to introduce the facility to buy tickets for Aapli Bus on mobile phones. For this, NMC is tying up with a private operator Chalo App. Using this app, commuters can also locate the bus and see timetable, eliminating need to wait. About state government’s economic survey that shows NMC had earned Rs 84 lakh profit from city bus operation in last financial year, Kukde and transport manager Shivajirao Jagtap said NMC had suffered Rs 76.5 crore loss. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

One more arrested in Viju Mohod murder c.description: NAGPUR: One Nikhil Tidke was arrested by crime branch on Wednesday for his alleged involvement in Vijay Mohod murder case. The cops had produced Tidke before the court on Thursday. The court has remanded Tidke to the custody of crime branch till June 23. Mohod was killed on May 16 by Ahaby Raut, Tidke, Suraj Karlawar and others following a dispute over gambling. The rivals had kidnapped Mohod from a Saoji eatery before stabbing him to death following a spat in the moving car which was driven by Karlawar. Raut and Karlawar were arrested earlier. They too are in remand till June 23. Mohod, having two murders cases against him in the past, was killed over rivalry to operate gambling den at Kharsoli. It’s learnt that Mohod already had a gambling den operating at Dhamna. He was trying to ensure Raut was forced to take him as partner at Kharsoli which led to the dispute. API Kiran Choughule of crime branch, who is also the investigation officer in the case, said the CCTV footage of the eatery would be soon referred for more evidences following which more arrests are likely. “We are trying to gather as much evidence as possible before making further arrests,” he said. The senior officers of the crime branch have also indicated that stringent provision is set to be invoked in the case. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NU to recall \u2018wrong degrees\u2019 o.description: Nagpur: A week after TOI exposed a major flaw of Nagpur University which was awarding ‘wrong degrees’ of postgraduate mass communication course, its administration led by vice chancellor SP Kane decided to recall those on Thursday.On June 14, TOI had reported how NU had awarded ‘Master of Mass Communication (MMC)’ degrees since last four to five years even though its usage was stopped from 2009 when TOI had exposed same issue in 2007. NU used to offer Bachelor of Mass Communication (BMC) and MMC degrees then. After TOI report that nomenclatures of both degrees were not as per the UGC norms and both degrees were illegal, NU constituted a panel under the then head of department at Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University in Aurangabad, Sudhir Gawhane, to tackle the crisis. The then administration under ex-VC SN Pathan and GS Parasher changed them to ‘Bachelor of Journalist (BJ)’ and ‘MA in Mass Communication’ in 2009 to fit them as per norms.NU Board of Examination and Evaluation (BOEE) director (officiating) Anil Hirekhan confirmed that NU had decided to recall those “wrong degrees” and award new ones. “We’ve found that only 59 students were awarded those degrees with wrong nomenclature at NU’s Department of Mass Communication and Dhanwate National College (DNC). Of them, about 20-25 were taken by the students from their respective colleges while others are with their offices. We’ve directed colleges to convey students and ask them to return their degrees.”Hirekhan said NU would award them revised degrees probably in a week. The university too came to know about the gaffe after TOI report. He refused to divulge details about how such a major blunder took place and which officials were behind it.“Only after an inquiry the exact reason could be ascertained. It’s the job of my seniors and I don’t want to comment on it,” said Hirekhan.Exam section insiders told TOI that they had properly awarded ‘MA is Mass Communication’ degrees till about 2015. “Some problems with software were developed and NU officials accidentally used old version due to which old nomenclature of MMC was published on the degrees. Such degrees were awarded for only two batches 2015-17 and 2016-18. Though NU officials later corrected the blunder after realizing their folly, they kept entire issue under the wraps to escape ignominy.”Aggrieved students, who had flayed NU for playing with their future thanked TOI for taking up their cause that led the university to change its decision. “After reading news in TOI, we had protested and even planned to meet VC in this regard soon. We want that guilty should be punished as many such goof ups are committed by its officials regularly. Due to this error, we were denied entry to doctoral programmes and also employers questioned us on nomenclature of the degree which wasn’t recognized by the UGC and AICTE,” they said.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

13 BArch aspirants move HC for admission.description: NAGPUR: Thirteen Architecture aspirants have knocked the judiciary’s doors, challenging Council of Architecture’s (COA) decision to change the basic eligibility criteria for admissions. A division bench comprising justices Ravi Deshpande and Vinay Joshi on Thursday, issued notices to the respondents including Delhi-based COA, State CET Cell and others. The petitioners — Devansh Malviya and 12 others — through counsels Bhanudas Kulkarni and Rohan Malviya, questioned central government’s (COA’s) powers to thrust its recommendations through May 29, 2017 and Feb 12, 2019, notifications. Though they cleared National Aptitude Test in Architecture (NATA) which was mandatory for admissions to architecture courses, they were declared ineligible to join, as they failed to secure 50% marks individually in Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics (PCM) group as per new norms framed by COA, which is an apex body like AICTE. According to them, the newly prescribed norms are beyond the COA’s powers and hence, arbitrary and untenable. They argued that their admissions are valid according the previously enforced criteria back of 2016, which must be followed as of now. They prayed for scrapping the new norms and ensuring their admissions, as their future is at stake. Kulkarni contended that COA council never accepted the newly prescribed norms including 50% each in PCM and aggregate as well. Opposing his contentions, Nahush Khubalkar, pleading on CET Cell’s behalf, informed that COA under Section 21 of Architects Act has powers to decide the eligibility criteria for admissions, which was vested by the Architects Act. In 2014, the COA made NATA or JEE (Joint Entrance Exam) mandatory for the eligibility. Later in its 64th meeting on August 27, 2015, it fixed the eligibility for admissions to BArch courses where it fixed 10+2 with PCM and 50% marks in aggregate for securing a seat. The new criteria was implemented from the academic session 2017-18. The apex body had clarified that no candidate shall be eligible for the architecture course unless he/she has passed 10+2 or equivalent with aggregate 50% marks and individually as well in PCM. In 2016, COA issued a letter to the State Department of Higher and Technical Education that there should be an amendment in the minimum criteria for the students to take admissions in BArch course. (With inputs from Sharwari Lohakare) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nTheatre connoisseurs enjoy the thrills.description: Enid Blyton’s classic English story— Five on a Treasure Island — from the famous five series was recently staged as a play in the city and it received great response from the theatre lovers. The play was directed by Vikash Khurana and had many thrilling and adventurous moments coupled with timely humour to keep the audience’s interest levels intact till the end. The young actors delighted the discerning audience with their performances and Khurana’s role as an antagonist was also appreciated by everyone. When we asked the director whether he had any inhibitions prior to the staging of the play, he said, “My biggest concern was to incorporate various scenes from the play on a small stage, but with proper planning, we managed to transcend the audience to Kirrin Island and the English countryside where the story is set.” We saw educationist Dr Dipti Christian and theatre person Aditya Bansod enjoying the theatrical treat with their friends.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. International Yoga Day 2019: PM urges country to embrace Yoga"We should make efforts to take yoga from cities to villages and tribal areas. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. For centuries, the essence of Yoga has remained the same… https://t.co/isvMOUTrn8— PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1561080804000The main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Best pictures from International Yoga Day 2019"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Follow live updates: International Yoga DayThe main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Vikas Mahatme feels allocation of Rs 100.description: NAGPUR: Rajya Sabha member Dr Vikas Mahatme, the ophthalmologist from the city who had emerged as the mass leader of Dhangars in 2013 during a BJP-backed agitation seeking reservation as scheduled tribes (ST) for the community, said the move to allocate Rs 1,000 crore in the state budget for the community will go a long way. Even as the demand for reservation will not be withdrawn earmarking of such an amount will certainly leave the community enthused. “The grudge that Dhangars have not been granted ST status will certainly not come in the way of the good news that as much as Rs1,000 crore has been sanctioned. This has set a precedent as never before a substantial amount was specifically sanctioned for the benefit of a single community,” Mahatme told TOI. Before the state elections, BJP had promised Dhangars, a community of shepherds who are now classified as nomadic tribes (NT), reservation as STs. The promise has remained unfulfilled. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that the government will send its recommendations to the centre on the basis of a report on Dhangars’ socio-economic status prepared by the Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS). Even as TISS has submitted its report in November 2018, it has not been tabled in the state assembly. However, Mahatme said not getting ST status may not affect Dhangars votes for the BJP. Dhangar leaders in NCP and Congress have called the allocation a mere eyewash. They said they would be taking up the issue with their respective party high commands demanding that a mass agitation should be launched. Mahatme’s own popularity had waned after he accepted the Rajya Sabha seat from BJP and the agitation lost steam. Mahatme said, “Reservation is affirmative action intended for the benefit of a certain class. Finally, if benefit is the aim, it can also come through measures announced in the budget.” he said. On the reservation issue, he said, “The BJP has at least declared a package but no other party is talking about reservation.” The Rs1,000 crore include facilities like scholarships and assistance for buying land. Ram Hari Roopkunwar, a Dhangar leader from Congress in Sholapur, said, “BJP has only exploited the community for votes.” He said will he put up a proposal in a forthcoming meeting of various community leaders and a mass agitation will be launched. Ramrao Wadkute of NCP in Hingoli said that the Dhangars have been left disillusioned. “It is just an allocation. The final implementation will take its own time. I will be taking up the issue with the party leadership and woo the community to launch a struggle. The Dhangar leaders are ready with all the resources,” he said. More orange farmers call in with \u2018d.description: NAGPUR: After TOI’s report on dying orange orchards in Amravati and Nagpur districts that appeared on Wednesday, more farmers called in to narrate their woes. Shridhar Solo, from Warud and an ex-ZP member, said that the government was sitting over a proposal of Lakhara Laghu Sinchan Yojna (irrigation project). “Over 30 lakh trees have died. Irrigation secretary (Eknath Dhwale) should be held responsible for this,” he said. City homeopath Dr Gopal Bhutada said that he owned about 3,000 trees near Benoda village in Warud tehsil. “But there are no irrigation facilities to cater to the area’s water needs for the orange crop,” he said. Bhutada added that an irrigation scheme had approval and water would have been available in plenty but “execution of the project has been delayed due to unknown reasons”. Bawanrao Warade, from Mohpa-Mohgaon village in Kalmeshwar tehsil, also called for government action in favour of farmers. Wandu Wasankar, from village Khadsi in Achalpur tehsil in Amravati district, owns a 20-acre orchard with 3,000 orange trees. He told TOI that orchards had dried up in Akot, Chandur Bazar and Anjangaon tehsils too. “The Sapan dam which is nearby is ready and holds water. But the government has not created channels to supply water to farmers,” he said. According to Ravi Patil, who is also from Achalpur tehsil, the Sapan dam has a huge catchment area. “Water could have been brought from Chandrabhaga dam too,” he added. Parag Kadu, of Pardi Deshmukh village in Kamleshwar tehsil, says that though he has managed to keep most of his orchard “alive, 600 trees have dried up”. The situation is worst in Chakdo, Ramgiri and Kahiri villages, according to him. Vasant Chaple, from Lohari Sangi village in Narked tehsil, says that he has lost 900 trees so far. “The ‘Kar water project’ is close by. It still holds 50% water but the government has not left any in the river for irrigation which resulted in the drying up of orchards. At least some trees could have been saved if water would have been released,” he said. Kahapa (Narkhed tehsil) village sarpanch Pramod Bannagre said that the Khapa project water reservoir is pending since 1982. “We met guardian minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule last year. He called a meeting but the micro-irrigation department said that they had lost all documentation. The project is dead,” he said. There is news of fresh estimates being prepared. “If the situation continues like this, the farmers will be forced to move out from here,” said Bannagre. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur water crisis set to aggravate as.description: NAGPUR: Water crisis in the city as well as for irrigation in the district is likely to increase compared to this year as Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) will be unable to utilize running water of Kanhan river. The huge saving of water in Pench reservoirs will not be possible as the water resources department (WRD) is all set to miss the deadline for completing Kochchhi barrage on Kanhan river by December-end. The NMC standing committee on Tuesday approved the water works department’s proposal to appoint WAPCOS Limited, a central government company, to prepare Detailed Project Report (DPR) and also execute the project to use running water of Kanhan river instead of water from Pench reservoirs for six months, from June to December. The civic body will pay WAPCOS Rs21.99 crore for the project. NMC uses water from Pench reservoirs to supply drinking water to 70% areas of the city throughout the year. Requirement of remaining water is met from running water of Kanhan river. During summer, Kanhan river has to be fed from Pench reservoirs. Huge quantum of water goes waste from Kanhan river between June and December due to lack of a reservoir on it. Therefore, NMC planned to lay a pipeline from Kanhan river and use this running water instead of water from Pench reservoirs in these six months. The plan approved on Tuesday will take at least one year for WAPCOS Limited to prepare DPR and complete the project. The plan was prepared in June last year but was delayed due to reasons known only to NMC officials. Due to shortage of water in Pench reservoirs, WRD could not supply water for irrigation during both, kharip and rabbi, seasons. NMC is drawing water from dead stock of Pench reservoirs for last one month. The Pench reservoirs are likely to get less water this year too due to construction of Chaurai dam by Madhya Pradesh upstream of Pench river. Therefore, the delay in mitigation measures is likely to increase the water crisis next year. Ruling party leader Sandip Joshi admitted the inordinate delay from the water works department in completing the process. “We have decided to award the work to WAPCOS Limited without going for tendering process due to the delay. The project would have been delayed further in case of tendering,” he said. Standing committee chairman Pradip Pohane said he would check about the delay and take appropriate action. In another setback, WRD officials confirmed water cannot be stored in Kochchhi barrage this monsoon. “Some 80% of the works are completed. Project require another Rs300 crore for completion. We will be able to store water only in the next monsoon,” they said. The barrage costing Rs947 crore is the first on Kanhan river. Around 75 million meter cube (MMC) water could have been stored in the barrage if it had been completed in time. The project was delayed due to shortage of funds. Panel wants passes at 500m onWadsa-Gadch.description: Nagpur: The regional empowered committee (REC) of the MoEFCC has recommended underpasses at every 500 metres in forest patches between the proposed Wadsa-Gadchiroli railway line which needs diversion of 83 hectares land.“We recommended additional box culverts or underpasses at every 500 metres inside the forest need to be constructed as per the design approved by Wildlife Institute of India (WII), Dehradun, for wildlife movement,” said REC member Suresh Chopne. The minutes of the REC meeting were released recently.The South East Central Railway (SECR), Nagpur, is executing the Rs800 crore project to construct new 52.86km broad gauge line between Wadsa-Gadchiroli ostensibly to transport iron ore and minerals from Gadchiroli and Chhattisgarh in the future. The project is being implemented on PPP basis and Maharashtra government has agreed to share 50% cost.Though the REC has given in-principle approval to the project, there are hiccups over taking mitigation measures. Of the 83 hectares dense forest, some 4km passes through tiger-bearing areas. Chopne said the REC decided working permission will be granted only after funds for taking up mitigation measures as suggested by the committee of WII and NTCA are deposited by the user agency.Among the other recommended mitigation steps include maximum speed of trains while approaching and passing through forest area shall be 40 kmph during night and 50 kmph during day time. “We have also asked the SECR to remove two stations from forest patches which will bring down the proposed forest diversion area,” he said.However, talking to TOI, senior SECR officials said the REC itself has desired that a study will be carried out by a joint team of WII and NTCA to suggest mitigation measures. The suggestion of WII-NTCA will be binding on SECR. The forest department is coordinating the joint inspection schedule.“We are ready to take mitigation measures and increase the span of bridges. We are also not averse to 500 metre underpasses in forested patches but many odd conditions are being put forward. If REC or WII-NTCA is not satisfied by our mitigation steps and proposes to go for elevated viaduct on piers it will lead to cost escalation making the project infeasible,” SECR officials said.Based on REC suggestion, a one-man NTCA team consisting of Hemant Kamdi from regional office here had already conducted a site visit on January 22, 2019 and observed that mitigation measures should be taken as per the WII guidelines on ‘Eco-friendly measures to mitigate impacts of linear infrastructure on wildlife’ approved by the MoEFCC.According to forest sources, the NTCA team suggested transplantation of trees instead of felling, underpasses for reptile species, besides 5% of the project cost to mitigate negative impact of the project and forming monitoring committee to oversee whether mitigation steps are as per WII green infrastructure guidelines.As per WII’s eco-friendly mitigation guideline document the user agencies need to follow hierarchy of mitigation steps where avoidance is the best option. It also suggests considering not only engineering aspects like underpasses but speed and traffic control and integrate options of light and sound barriers, camouflaging and landscaping.Wadsa deputy conservator (DyCF) Niranjan Vivrekar said, “We have sought undertakings from the railways on mitigation steps and other set of conditions. Once we receive it the proposal will be forwarded to PCCF office.”WII GUIDELINES SAY ...* Follow hierarchy of mitigation measures given in the guidelines where avoidance is best option* Consider not only engineering option like underpasses but regulatory mechanism like speed and traffic control* Follow design, dimension for large carnivore and herbivore and as per the available corridor patch size. Thumb rule is of 5 metres clear height and 300m/km span coverage* Integrate options for movement of reptiles, birds and arboreal mammals* Integrate options of light and sound barriers, camouflaging, landscapingENDS Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Month of Ramzan propagates message.description: Nagpur: The month of Ramzan is not just to celebrate one's happiness. It serves a purpose of understanding our responsibility towards other people and to assess ourselves, said member of Muslim Personal Law Board, Abdul Wahab Parekh, on Wednesday. He presided over the function ‘Daawat-e-sheer khurma’ organized by Wahadat-e-Islami Hind Nagpur at Ahbab Community Hall, Anant Nagar. Retired geologist at Mineral Exploration Corporation Limited (MECL) SK Gupta was the chief guest.Parekh added, "It is our moral duty to understand our neighbours, their culture and identity. We all need to build a bond that cements our society together and work for peace alongside all people of goodwill. We follow the orders of the creator of this universe during the month of Ramzan. If one follows these rules for the remaining 11 months too, they are ought to lead a peaceful afterlife."In his opening remark, Member of Wahadat-e-Islam, Mohammad Irshad, shed light on the history of Ramzan. He said, "This festival was initiated in Medina after the migration of prophet Muhammad from Mecca. People are aware of Ramzan as the month when we undergo a period of fasting. Through this festival, Islam teaches the communal aspects of the fast like empathy for the underprivileged. One understands the graveness of hunger and thirst." Elaborating on the significance of organizing the programme, Irshad said, "The objective of this Daawat is to interact with people of all communities and share the sweet dessert with everyone in order to untangle the knot which has been formed among people."Speaking at the celebration, Gupta said, "Humanity is our ultimate religion. Gradually, we are losing our touch with humanity and we need to evaluate ourselves ."Abdul Wahab Malak conducted the programme. The traditional dessert, sheer khurma, was distributed among everyone. He said, "The crime rate is at all-time high with the increase in number of cases of rape, murder, etc. The only way to stop this is to awaken the essence of god watching over us throughout our good and bad deeds. This message is propagated through the month of Ramzan."Mohammed Irshad recited a verse 'Surah Rahman' from the Quran.endsDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chainsukh Sancheti takes over as VDB cha.description: NAGPUR: Chainsukh Sancheti, a five-term MLA of the Bharatiya Janata Party from Malkapur constituency in Buldhana district has finally assumed the charge of chairman of the Vidarbha Development Board (VDB). His appointment was initially announced in June last year. One of the senior-most BJP MLAs, he has been getting elected continuously since 1995 from Buldhana district. A very loyal worker of the party, his family has strong roots in the RSS. Sancheti till recently stayed away from power. He was appointed on June 11 last year as the development board chairman. But Sancheti was apparently not that keen on the post and instead sought a ministerial berth though the board chairman’s post has cabinet minister status. Now with his 5th term coming to an end in a few months, he accepted the post just after he could not make it to the cabinet in a reshuffle on Sunday by chief minister Devendra Fadnavis. On Monday, in the presence of VDB member Dr Kapil Chandrayan, board deputy director Prakash Dayre and staff he took charge and expressed his commitment to give a boost to the VDB work by pursuing pending issues with the governor who is the statutory head of the board. An MSc in chemistry, Sancheti also dabbled in the construction business before starting his political career as municipal council member and then MLA for five terms from Malkapur. In college days he was a keen wrestler. He is the uncle of influential ex-MP Ajay Sancheti. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Meet focuses on woes of backward communi.description: NAGPUR: Tribal Welfare Department commissionarate held a meeting to discuss about the problems faced by Schedule Tribes at Upper Ayukta Adivasi Vibhag Hall, Giripeth, on Thursday. Sandeep Rathore, an official of the department, heard the problems of the community members and promised action on the same. Dinesh Shiram, the main speaker, explained Rathore about various issues the community is facing and sought his help on the same. Shiram said, “A lot of crimes are happening in the locality which could be prevented with better security. CCTV cameras are not maintained properly. Proper maintenance of hostels is required. There are no security guards at these hostels. We request you to at least strengthen the security around girls hostels.” To this, Rathore suggested outsourcing of guards to solve the problem. “I would advise outsourcing of guards which will help you in employing some good security personnel,” Rathore said. Pushpa Uiky, a homemaker, asked the official for a Boston scholarship for her daughter. She said, “I have requested for a scholarship for my daughter for her higher studies. I have done my part. Let us see what happens next,” she said. Jyoti Ade, a high school graduate, requested Rathore for providing a psychiatrist or psychotherapist for school students. She said, “School students have a lot on their plate. Sometimes, there are issues which cannot be shared with friends. Proper guidance is required for better mental stability of the students.” She also probed the official to take action on better maintenance of school premises. Rahul Vinod, another youngster, commented on how students of Std I to IV had been assigned schools far away from their home. “How will students be able to go so far away to school every day? Won’t it be inconvenient and hectic?” he asked. Rathore heard all the complaints and promised to work for them. He also assured an audience with the higher authorities time to time. “I will talk to the higher authorities and see what they have to say in this regard,” he said. (Reporting by Shristi Sankrit) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Godown owner steals tenant\u2019s items.description: NAGPUR: Kalamna police on Tuesday registered a case burglary and trespassing against the owner of a godown for allegedly stealing items worth Rs 17 lakh from the godown. The accused, Rajendra Zade, 51, was having a dispute over vacating the godown with his tenant Ramesh Bhat, 54, over which he took the step. Police said Zade had give the godown on rent to Bhat a few years back. But recently the duo was having a dispute over the godown. Zade, a resident of Chhapru Nagar Chowk, along with his accomplices, broke open the lock and allegedly stole items worth Rs17 lakh from the godown. When the incident came to light, Bhat approached Kalamna police and filed a complaint. Kalamna police have registered a case of burglary, theft and trespassing against Zade and his accomplices. Police are yet to make any arrests in the matter. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Nagpur HC asks judge to verify all safet.description: NAGPUR: Continuing its tough stand on lack of facilities in District and Sessions Court complex here, the Nagpur bench of Bombay High Court on Wednesday directed the principal district judge (PDJ) to verify all compliances as claimed by the state public works department (PWD) and submit a report in 20 days. A division bench comprising justices Ravi Deshpande and Vinay Joshi was hearing an application moved by lawyer Manoj Sable where he pointed out lack of facilities in the lower court premises due to which three women lawyers were stuck up in one of the lifts and needed to be admitted in the ICU after being suffocated on June 11. The application was filed in PIL (No 67/2015) by Sable through counsel Shreerang Bhandarkar praying for directives to the PWD for construction of additional infrastructure like courts and bar rooms for convenience of lawyers and litigants. Firdos Mirza appeared for high court, while Uday Dable pleaded for District Bar Association (DBA). Earlier, the judges added ThyssenKrupp Elevators, which was having annual maintenance contract (AMC) for the lifts in entire District and Sessions’ Court complex, as a respondent in the case, following its failure to do servicing of lifts that led to last week’s accident. In its affidavit, the PWD executive engineer (electrical division) Manish Patil informed that generator set for providing backup for lifts was purchased way back in 1968 and has now become outdated. The work order to purchase a 500 KVADG set of generator is given to the agency to assist 100% power backup. He sought 40 days to replace it with new one. However, the judges turned down his request, asking him to complete the formalities within 20 days. Patil also referred to some of the points raised by PDJ Vibha Ingle in her affidavit to the court where she had pointed out non-compliance of 16 electrical works by the PWD. He informed that most of the works were completed in this regard. In last hearing, the bench had directed respondents to ensure sufficient measures for fire safety in the building, to avoid any eventuality. To this, the PWD informed that for fire safety measures, an estimate was technically sanctioned by the department and its tender was floated on June 11. Its tender bid would open on July 5. The administrative approval for installing new fire fighting system was received on June 12. Patil came out with startling revelation that the work on providing firefighting system could be completed within 40 days and later permission from the Nagpur municipal Corporation (NMC) could be obtained. It means, there is no firefighting system in the premises which is thronged by over 20,000 visitors every day, thus putting their lives at a big risk in case of emergency, according to lawyers. (With inputs from Sharvari Lohkare) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Move to privatize train ops is disastrou.description: NAGPUR: The National Railway Mazdoor Union (NRMU) has termed the railway ministry move to rope in private players to operate mail/express trains as disastrous. Talking to mediamen on Thursday, Venu Nair, general secretary of NRMU, said roping private players to run trains is one of the agenda items in the 100-day programme chalked out for all divisions in the country. Nair said outsourcing of core jobs will not only spell doom for employees but also passengers. “We will not shy away from stopping the railway operations to oppose anti-employee policies by the Railway Board,” he added. One of the agenda items finalized during the recent meeting of general managers addressed by railway minister Piyush Goyal is about rolling out Wi-Fi at 6,800 stations in the country. Nair asked, “Was there need for Wi-Fi at stations in remote places where there are few travellers. Instead of taking such projects, the railways should channelize the funds into upgradation of infrastructure.” The NRMU leader was also critical of railway ministry move to ask people to give up subsidy on railway tickets which will hit poor passengers hard. Instead of taking such petty decisions, Nair suggested vigilance wing of the railways to target engineering departments that are in eye of storm for irregularities. Nagpur division NRMU leaders Habib Khan, Narendra Dhanfule, Pramod Bokde, Manoj Choithani, Debashish Bhattacharya, Saji Koshi, Emanuel Rao and others were also present. Foreign doctors of Indian origin keen to.description: NAGPUR: Doctors of Indian origin in foreign countries have shown interest in coming back to India and work as faculty in the newly opened medical colleges. Dr Ramesh Mehta, president of Global Association of Physicians of Indian Origin (GAPIO), was in Nagpur on Monday. He told TOI his organization had submitted a proposal to NITI Ayog that 10,000 doctors based in UK who will retire in next two-three years were willing to join medical colleges as faculty. Mehta said the proposal was welcomed by NITI Ayog and the Indian officials were very positive about it. “I belong to the UK unit of GAPIO, known as British Association of Physicians of Indian Origin. We have 65,000 members. In next two years, 10,000 of these will be retiring and they are willing to work in India,” said Dr Mehta. According to him, the acute shortage of medical faculty in India could be addressed if these doctors are allowed to work. “NITI Ayog officials agreed to provide necessary amenities, documentation and salary as per international standards to them. All of them are Indians by origin. They are willing to work for the nation,” Dr Mehta added. He also revealed another plan of GAPIO to mentor fresh MBBS graduates for four years after their degree. “Due to very limited number of post-graduation (MD/MS) seats in India, fresh MBBS graduates face many problems. We have submitted a plan to train fresh MBBS graduates for two years in India followed by two years in UK. This will be on-the-job training and doctors will get salaries as per British standards during their stay in UK,” said Dr Mehta. He made it clear the plan was not intended to drive brain drain. “After two years of training in UK, candidates will return to India and they have to serve here for a significant time. They will be trained under clinical knowledge development program (CKDP) which is popular module of GAPIO,” Mehta added. NITI Ayog’s vision document ‘Strategy for New India @75’ states an active search strategy, or visiting/adjunct faculty system from India and abroad, and any other methods will be used to deal with faculty shortages in new medical institutes. \nRaisoni College organises get-together.description: A get-together organised recently by the Raisoni College of Commerce, Science and Technology was high on fun and camaraderie. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

A blend of medical studies and engineeri.description: Practice makes a man perfect. This phrase has motivated almost every successful person till date. Stepping into any field requires a notion of ability regarding the interest invested, along with time and energy. No stream or study has ever been victoriously chased if it lacks choice or interest. Most students in this generation opt for science after their class X, but fail to choose between engineering and medical, as they have a share of interest in both the fields. For such students, pharmacy is the right choice. Pharmacy is a blend of medical studies and engineering minds. This subject can help one find the right direction towards a career path. Pharmacy has a huge scope in the business sector. For the past few years, production, supply and demand for medicines has only increased. The requirement does not seem to have a stop either. For all those who are interested in entrepreneurship, pharmacy is a great option. Nayan Bajaj, a medical store owner and a businessman, said, “There is an undying scope in pharmacy studies. The developments and new technologies have only taken this field to a higher level. A diploma course in pharmacy is mandatory for those who rely in the field of business itself. For higher studies, bachelor’s and master’s degrees are compulsorily required.” “Doctors and medicines are soul partners who are interconnected and cannot really function without each other. Pharmacy, in this way, soars as one of the best professions,” he added. Advancements in every field has reached heights in this era, whereas researches seem never to end. Every day, a new technology is discovered. Even in pharmacy, clinical research is a great choice. Neha Kriplani, a clinical research associate, said, “The profession is helpful and effective for as long as there is requirement for medicines. There is a huge scope in this field as almost everyone today is a consumer and scientists are keen producers.” “Different companies and departments offer high-paying job to degree holders. Clinical research deals with testing and producing of medicines, and this field is widely resourceful. Pharmacy gives an opportunity to understand both a patient’s life as well as a doctor’s work,” she said. Mohit Wadhwani, a pharmacist, said, “The number of patients is increasing day by day. This has led to a drastic increase in production of medicines. The profession is highly standardized for those students who have an equal interest in biology and mathematics. This field gives a chance to figure out a marketeer’s life completely. There is a great scope and this field is one such section where knowledge of almost every subject and practical life is streamed.” XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX Why opt for the subject Desire for flexibility in career choice Unique approach to healthcare Benefit from the demand of pharmacists Work with state-of-the-art technology XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX Expert View Dr Abhay Ittadwar Career scope, job opportunities huge Once a child is admitted to a school, there are no other options but to continue the studies without few alterations till Std X. So, after passing SSC, the natural question is ‘what next?’ Here, one has to be selective to opt for one of the streams among science, commerce and arts, while another choice is polytechnic, depending upon the passion and eligibility. Once the science stream is opted for, there are further choices like physics, chemistry & biology i.e. PCB group or physics, chemistry & mathematics i.e. PCM group or both mathematics and biology group. The current trend, which has likely become common these days, is medical sciences or engineering. For those who do not fulfill the merit list demands, and have opted for PCM or PCB or PCMB, pharmacy is the right choice to step in. Pharmacy offers a variety of subjects along with diploma and degree courses. Pharmaceutical companies have a suitable amount of share in the market. Hence, it is one of the leading occupations with a business choice. One can opt pharmacy for a career in production, research, quality assurance, regulation affairs, patents, corporates, academics, hospitals, entrepreneurship and so on. Recent trend and technologies like artificial intelligent, 3D printing, biotechnology, nanotechnology etc has further increased the scope. Career scope and job opportunities in pharmacy are huge. Due to opening of large pharmaceutical companies and government policies like startup, Make in India, generic medicines etc, the future in this field is bright. Numerous jobs are available for pharmacists in government as well as private organizations. After completing studies, one can easily find jobs in pharmaceutical industries, government departments, universities, hospitals, investigation and research institutes etc or can opt for entrepreneurship. It takes a lot of technique and expertise to prepare medicinal drugs and review it. People take it lightly what a pharmacist does but it really is a big deal. A bright and prosperous career can be made in it. Every medical student should consider it as a career option Mayank Deo Singh Being a pharmacist for a while now, I can proudly say that I love my job and would recommend it to everyone who is interested in it. Pharmacy is an art and is as important as any other profession. It takes a lot of studying to reach where I have reached and it is always worth it Akrosh Chaturvedi The industry of pharmaceuticals is big and is expected to grow more. It is a very beneficial industry and is also welcoming. Students do not have to study as much as they have to in medical, but it is equally rewarding and important. It is funny how people undermine pharmacy Sanjay Singh It is a very rewarding and prosperous field. All the aspirants who would like to join it should remember that you should never be a pharmacist if you do not have a licence. It is very dangerous. To ensure the safety of public, it is important that you do not play with anyone’s life Pawan Kumar Mishra Coming from a medical background, I always saw myself doing something in the same field. I am extremely lucky to have gotten the opportunity to pursue my career in pharmacy. \nHeart-wrenching tale enthralled Nagpur.description: A Marathi play Vyakti aani Valli was recently staged at Dr Vasantrao Deshpande Hall. Nagpur’s theatre buffs enjoyed a mélange of various characters and their eccentricities. Theatrical adaption of a book penned by legendary litterateur P L Deshpande, the rib-tickling play — directed by Chandrakant Kulkarni — had popular names from Marathi film and theatre world in the star cast. Actor-director Mahesh Manjrekar, Sunil Barve, Bhau Kadam, Anand Ingale etc. swept the audience off their feet with their impeccable comic timing and strong dialogue delivery. Needless to say, the auditorium reverberated with loud applause when the show ended. Gotya Sawant also garnered praises as a sutradhar. Former Union cabinet minister, Vilas Muttemwar with wife Chhaya, former Maha ministers Anil Deshmukh and Ranjit Deshmukh with wife Rupa enjoyed the play. Divisional Commissioner Anoop Kumar and IPS officers Deepali Masirkar and Rohan Samant were also spotted. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nStudents of ETC department of Yeshwant.description: It was time for the final year students of ETC department, Yeshwantrao Chavan College of Engineering, to bid goodbye to their college life. The farewell bash, which was organised recently on the college premises, was full of fun and nostalgia. Partying with their friends one last time, youngsters experienced a gamut of emotions. While outstation students were sad to leave the city, many seemed excited to join the companies they have been placed in through campus recruitment. Girls and boys didn’t forget to click numerous selfies and group snaps, which were instantly updated on their social media accounts. To add some more fun to the bash, various games were organised wherein seniors and juniors enthusiastically participated. Later, a leg-pulling session not only evoked plenty of laughter, but also proved to be a catalyst in making the bond stronger between the juniors and seniors. Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Citizens all set to celebrate Internatio.description: NAGPUR: The fifth International Yoga Day is on June 21 and citizens are all geared up to take out their mats and sweat it out as a step towards a healthy body and a peaceful mind. This year’s theme for the day is ‘Climate action’ to realized one’s responsibilities towards making a breathable environment. The city will be observing a number of events to mark the day. The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) along with Yogabhyasi Mandal will organize ‘Yoga day celebrations’ at Yashwant Stadium at 5.45am, on Friday. Union minister Nitin Gadkari will be the chief guest along with state minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule. Ram Khandwe of Yogabhyasi Mandal said, “Around 30,000-40,000 people are expected to attend the event. We have made arrangements for a big projector which will make it convenient for the public to perform yogasanas.” The South Central Zone Cultural Centre (SCZCC), in keeping with its five-year legacy, is all set to celebrate the day at 6.30am. Yoga practitioners are expected in comfortable clothing armed with their mats. Aaranya & Vivekananda Kendra Nagpur are jointly organizing ‘Yoga for the heart’ at 6am at Vivekananda Smarak, Ambazari, on Friday. Satya Sanatana Yoga’s will hold multiple sessions from June 20-23 for yoga enthusiasts. On June 20, it is scheduled from 7.30am to 8.30am at Baheti IVF Centre and JCI Nagpur. The events will begin from 5.45am to 7.30am at Guards Regimental Centre, Kamptee, 7.30am to 8.30am at Swami Dayananda Girls School, 9am to 10am at Zee Mount Litera School, 10.30am to 11.30am at Dr B R Ambedkar College of Management and Research, 11.45am to 12.45pm at G H Raisoni College, 1pm to 2.15pm at UII and the last session from 4pm to 5pm at Zee Mount Litera School, Pratap Nagar. Events have also been scheduled on June 22 and 23 at Empress Mall from 9am to 10am and 6.30am to 8.00am at Mahindra and Mihan respectively. Kedar Joshi from Satya Sanatana said, “I am a psychotherapist and a yoga teacher and so, I will conduct various lectures on personal growth, intellectual thinking, recovery disorders and physical illness.” Yoga enthusiasts can also attend the two-day celebrations at Bharat Van, the green belt of the city, with multiple sessions starting from on June 2. Organizer Jaydeep Das said, “We have organized this event for the public in the lap of nature. What better way to do yoga in open space with nature.” Event one will be held on Friday from 5.30am to 6.30am where Nakul Agrawal will give a talk ‘What is Yoga’ followed by Margesh Sapate’s flute music rendition. On June 22, Bharat Van will organize two events, the first from 6am to 7.30am with a talk by Jay Shukla followed by demonstration of common yogasanas by Jay Shukla and Swati Gupta. Another event will be held from 5.30pm to 6.30pm where Agrawal will deliver a talk on ‘meditation’ followed by guided meditation accompanied by Handpan music by Parvinder Singh. Yoga practitioner Dhanashree Lekruwale and Guinness Book Record holder Jyoti Amge will perform yoga at Ambedkar Garden at 7.30am on June 20. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Accused not a terrorist only for using w.description: NAGPUR: The Akola sessions court recently acquitted three men arrested on terror charges under the stringent Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA), 1967. Absolving them, special judge AS Jadhav pointed out that an “accused can’t be labelled as a terrorist just because he was using the word jihad”. “As per the dictionary, ‘jihad’ literally means ‘struggle’. It’s an Arabic word which means striving or struggling. According to BBC, the third meaning of jihad is struggling to build a good society. Related words of jihad are expedition, administration, movement, strive crusade. Therefore, if merely accused used the word ‘jihad’, it would not be proper to brand him as terrorist,” the judge said, acquitting all three accused of charges under UAPA. Abdul Malik Abdul Razaqque, Shoeb Khan and Salim Malik had been arrested outside a Mohamadiya mosque in Pusad town of Yavatmal district after Razaqque allegedly attacked cops on September 25, 2015. He was enraged over the beef ban imposed by the Maharashtra government and attacked police constables Amol Badukale, Yogesh Dongarwar and Sudarshan Aghav with a knife, injuring them outside the mosque on Bakri Eid. After he was arrested, the case was handed over to Mumbai-based Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS). The ATS claimed Razaqque had come into contact with Khan on Facebook and introduced him to Malik. Both Khan and Malik then instigated Razaqque to join ‘jihadi movement’ and also lured him to go to Afghanistan for training. ATS pointed out that Razaqque was highly influenced by the speeches of Maulana Masood Azar, the founder of banned terrorist organization Jaish-e-Mohammad, which was behind the deadly attacks on the Parliament and the recent one at Pulwama, where 40 CRPF personnel were martyred. He even used to listen to inflammatory speeches of preacher Zakir Naik and Al Qaida founder Osama bin Laden. He also ran a WhatsApp group named ‘Friends Forever’, where inflammatory material was circulated. When Razaqque’s Facebook and Twitter accounts were checked, it was found that he was following jihadi groups. After arrest of all three, incriminating material such as CDs and Urdu material was seized. They were charged under various sections of IPC, Arms Act, and Bombay Police Act, besides UAPA. The charge sheet was filed with JMFC court in Nagpur, which remanded the case to Akola court. “It appears that Malik has exhibited his anger through violence against government and some Hindu organizations for ban on cow slaughtering. No doubt, he used the word ‘jihad’. But it was adventurous to jump to the conclusion that only for using word ‘jihad’ he should be branded as terrorist,” the judge said. The court, however, maintained Malik’s conviction under all IPC sections and sentenced him to three years behind bars. Since he was been in jail from September 25, 2015, he was released as he had already served his full term. The court asked Khan and Malik to furnish a surety of Rs15,000 each while acquitting them of all the charges. Speaking to TOI, Malik’s father said they were happy as justice was finally done. “I want to thank SP MLA Abu Azmi along with Afzal Farooki, Mayatai Chaure, Pervez Siddiqui from Nagpur for helping us in these tough times, where we lost everything. I am happy that my son had rejoined the Mohamadiya Masjid as a cleric. His son was just one-and-a-half-years-old when he was forcibly taken by the police.” He added that after his son’s arrest, they lost everything and suffered immense social stigma. “I suffered losses in my business. We were treated like outsiders in our hometown. Now, it’s up to chief minister Devendra Fadnavis to inquire into the matter and punish the guilty cops for falsely implicating my son and devastating our peaceful lives.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" 2 arrested in Navodaya bank fraud in Nag.description: NAGPUR: The economic offence wing (EOW) of the crime branch has arrested two former managers of Navodaya Urban Cooperative Bank in the Rs 38 crore co-operative scam. The accused — Rajesh Bante and Rajesh Bogul — were produced before a court on Wednesday and sent to PCR up to June 24. EOW had earlier booked former Congress MLA Ashok Dhawad and 16 directors of the bank on the basis of a complaint filed by the auditor of state department of cooperatives. The accused had allegedly duped investors by distributing bogus loans between 2010 and 2015. The accused had also allegedly written off loans of customers by forging documents and providing them no objection certificates. Such customers were again provided loan by the bank. The fraud was busted after investors approached cops. The cooperative bank had also gone into liquidation after its banking licence was cancelled six months ago.
